reviews.review_msg: The course was on religion, gender and the global south. While Ms. Zakiuddin is a very articulate speaker her approach is postmodern and most topics got bogged down in this incomprehensible, relativist jargon.  There is not much room, in general, for opposing viewpoints, particularly on religion, and specifically Islam.
This class was a demonstration of the professionalization of the Humanities, where relativism substitutes for objective analysis, content is exhausted but salaries need to be made.
